Entries.default:
A creature of smoke and scales, embers and talons looms up from the darkness.

Her back and ribs gleam luridly, red as the lake of fire that laps at her feet. She hisses, the sound like rocks grating together in her throat, and though her peeled-back lips forms no words, you understand.
<ispeech>Speak swiftly. It may well keep you alive.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Fare you well, trespasser. May I eat you - I mean, meet you - again someday.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Face my flames! Stare your death in its flickering eyes.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Who comes now to stoke the flames of chaos further?</ispeech>
<ispeech>Have I not yet feasted enough? I suppose I can make room for another...</ispeech>
"The Rathun summoned you... so you attacked them?"
[Attack] "Return to the Wheel, creature."
<ispeech>I am the HEART of the fire! I cannot be controlled. Not by a giant's weak will, and not by a sputtering trinket.</ispeech>
The dragon's rumbling laughter rattles the cavern's floor. Her wings quiver as she flexes to attack.
"Great creature of the Maw, are you not the least bit curious as to why I've come to speak with you?"
"You do make a convincing argument."

<ispeech>Did you now... come to my den, to entreat my attention?</ispeech>

She swivels her head to the side, studying you with a deadly intent.
"I need the Torc of Bithákten from the brenthís' body."
"That wouldn't be the brenthís over there, would it?"
"I must reach Eothas in the depths of the Maw."
Why did the Rathun summon you during Eothas' invasion?
"Magran would do anything to stop Eothas. If she erupts this volcano, you'll be destroyed along with it."
"Farewell."
The dragon spreads her wings possessively over her hoard, scaled throat rumbling a growl.
"Who said anything about stealing. Can we not make a trade?"
[Hold up your hands.] "All right. Never mind, then."
<ispeech>Take it. I have no care for the torc - or the corpse.</ispeech>

<ispeech>Indeed, what remains of her is on that mound over yonder.</ispeech>

The dragon whips her neck toward the mangled and blackened body of a Rathun at the far end of the cavern.
<ispeech>We struck a deal... eons ago. I did with a wily brenthís. It's true these... Rathun... fed me exquisitely for so long.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Should I believe the wretched words of a trespasser in my den?</ispeech>
"Believe me, dragon, I would not lie about such a grave matter."
<ispeech>I fly!</ispeech> With a great heave, she slogs her body from the magma and takes to the sky.

<ispeech>You think to ride ME - the Great Firestorm in the Maw - to meet a blustering god?</ispeech>

The massive beast's chuckles roll out like thunder, but acrid smoke puffs from her nostrils, underscoring her anger.
<ispeech>If the Rathun could not tame me, why should a little wretch like you fare better?</ispeech>
<ispeech>But today they sought my wings like a firestorm to battle - my fangs like hot spears to pierce a god.</ispeech>
<ispeech>I shall tell you this much, if only to keep you from my wings. Your path to Eothas lies through Magran... through her shrine within the Rathun's keep.</ispeech>
"Wait, I have no intent to fight you."
"Attack me, beast, and it'll be the last thing you ever do."
"Is that... is that a sacred torc I see? I happen to be in the market for one! Come, let us make a trade."
<ispeech>An easy meal is still a meal, is it not?</ispeech> The beast stretches her smoldering neck out as she chuffs.
<ispeech>You, wretch? Shall you end my ceaselessly enduring eons - when giants could not?</ispeech>
<ispeech>You trespass within my den, and now you think to thieve my treasures?!</ispeech>
<ispeech>Squeal and scurry or do not. I will suckle the marrow from your bones regardless soon enough.</ispeech>
"Creature, what have you done to these Rathun?"
<ispeech>We struck a deal... eons ago. I did with a wily brenthís. It's true these... Rathun... fed me exquisitely for so long.</ispeech>
<ispeech>But today they sought my wings like a firestorm to battle - my fangs like hot spears to pierce a god.</ispeech>
The dragon grants you a sly, black-fanged smile.
"What was the nature of the deal you struck with them?"
The beast grates a loud, insidious laugh.
<ispeech>The Rathun would pay their tributes of flesh and blood, fire, and gold - and I, when called upon, would fight fiercely at their side.</ispeech>
The dragon sloshes into a crouch in the magma, reconsidering.
<ispeech>I think not.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Tell me, what riches will I glean from your corpse? What fine baubles am I soon to pick from my teeth?</ispeech>
[Brandish your weapon.] "Take a gander and find out."
The dragon's rumbling laughter rattles the cavern's walls as she slithers her tail in the searing magma.
"You don't want to eat me. I'm much too stringy, and I'm sure to give you a belly ache."

<ispeech>Your tongue is clever. It amuses me.</ispeech>

She snorts smoke from her nostrils.
<ispeech>I am listening. Bleat louder, little morsel.</ispeech>
"That's not exactly what I had in mind. But now that you mention it..."
"Do you know of a physical path to the lower reaches of the Maw or not?"
"Because if you don't help me, I'll tear off your wings."
The dragon's body flares hotter.
<ispeech>Will you, wretch? Or will you scream for mercy within my flames?</ispeech>
<ispeech>Even she, a high priestess, could not withstand the bite of MY flames.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Even were it so - the fire feeds me. It can cause me no harm.</ispeech>
"You're clever to covet a sacred relic of Magran's. Her power over fire is supreme, after all."
"I understand your desire for that torc. History is full of dragons who hoard relics of power."
"What's that over there?"
"Stubborn creature! Your obstinance would see you dead. Allow mine to see that you live."
"You've lived too long to risk death now. Fly for safety, and return once the gods have settled their quarrel."
"Magran's fire can ravage even a god's body. She's killed Eothas before."
<ispeech>A wise decision.</ispeech> Her throat clacks with laughter.
The dragon's nostrils flare wide as she inhales. Slowly, her scaly lips peel back from her fangs.
<ispeech>But why should I barter when I can take it from your corpse?!</ispeech>
<ispeech>No, wretch, you possess nothing I desire.</ispeech>

"You are a creature to be revered! Your eminence derives not from your ability to mindlessly slaughter - no, as any dragon could do that - but from your ability to show mercy to your devoted followers."
"Do you wish to stare into death? I'm ready to deliver."
"Wait, there's something else."
<ispeech>Thieve from me - should you wish your corpse to join hers!</ispeech>
<ispeech>And what might that be?</ispeech>

<ispeech>But you do not desire to control me with it?</ispeech>

The dragon narrows her eyes at you.
"Think I'd let an item that could control me, as well, continue to exist?"
"I've no affinity for fire. Even if I tried, I couldn't control you."
<ispeech>I concede, in this matter we are allied.</ispeech>
[Lie] "I've no affinity for fire. Even if I tried, I couldn't control you."
<ispeech>I do scent something... enticing about you. A sword pulsing with a peculiar essence...?</ispeech>
<ispeech>I do scent something... enticing about you. A precious gem or two...?</ispeech>
<ispeech>I do scent something... enticing about you. Is that... a wardstone...?</ispeech>
<ispeech>No. You look like a creature who could lay even a dragon low.</ispeech>
She growls low in her throat, wings rippling over her back.
<ispeech>Cherish one of Magran's abject trinkets?! I do no such thing, wretch! I care nothing for her trifles!</ispeech>
The dragon preens, and her eyes flare bright as embers.

<ispeech>The Rathun are fools, devoted blindly to Magran. They never worshiped me - as I deserve.</ispeech>

Purring, she slithers and sloshes in the magma.
<ispeech>What? Where?!</ispeech> The dragon swivels her head sharply to one side.
Edér nods. "Keep it busy."

"Just keep its attention on you."

She nods, almost imperceptibly, and begins carefully sidestepping away.

Biting his lower lip, Tekēhu tips his head and offers no sign of recognition. 

Then he blinks as revelation hits him.
"Be distracting her, then, cap. A roast Serafen be nobody's idea of a good time."

"Just give me some cover, boss." 

Her brow lifts and she smiles.
"You keep her busy. I'll nab the torc." Xoti whisper-shouts before creeping toward the priestess' charred remains.
"Try to hold her attention."
[Whistle 'innocently' at Maia to indicate your intent.]
[Share a secret look with Tekēhu before nodding toward the torc.]
[Signal someone to sneak for the torc.]
[Do nothing.]

<ispeech>I see nothing! Nor do I like petty tricks, trespasser!</ispeech>

The dragon swings her head back around, rumbling a loud growl.
[Point at Xoti then jerk your thumb toward the torc.]
[Shake your head for him to refrain.] "Never mind."

<ispeech>The genesis of my memories begin when I was but a hatchling, fresh from the egg...</ispeech>

As the Ancient drones on, her speech crackling like dying embers, you find yourself struggling not to glance at your compatriot sneaking toward the priestess' corpse.
[Clear your throat and give Aloth a pointed look.]
[Jerk your chin for Edér to sneak for it.]
[Furtively wave for Pallegina to creep toward the torc.]
[Snap your fingers at Serafen to direct his attention toward the treasure.]
[Shake your head for her to refrain.] "Never mind."
"Dragon, regale me with a story of your greatness."

<ispeech>The immenseness of my existence spans eons. You may be moldy bones in the ground by the time I finish a single tale. 

But as you seem quite so eager...</ispeech>
<ispeech>Perhaps you speak the truth, and such may come to pass.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Plead your circumstance for eons. Still, I will not believe you.</ispeech>
<ispeech>I am the HEART of the fire! I cannot be controlled. Not by a giant's weak will, and not by a sputtering trinket.</ispeech>
She bares her fangs.
<ispeech>I shall tell you this much, if only to keep you from my wings. Your path to Eothas lies through Magran... through her shrine within the Rathun's keep.</ispeech>
Slowly, she flexes her wings. They sizzle and pop, nearly steaming.
<ispeech>I slumbered for ages and felt restless for longer. It shall be good to stretch my wings. To hunt.</ispeech>
<ispeech>How dare these gods war in my den!</ispeech>
<ispeech>I suppose...</ispeech> She rumbles in thought.
<ispeech>I told the Rathun I would have none of it. And I won't. I shall leave until the fires have cooled.</ispeech>
"You tricked the Rathun."
<ispeech>Indeed, I did. But you...</ispeech>
<ispeech>You seem far more clever.</ispeech>
"That wouldn't be the brenthís over there, would it?"

<ispeech>You mean the scorched remains on that mound over yonder?</ispeech>

The dragon whips her neck toward the mangled and blackened body of a Rathun at the far end of the cavern.
The dragon grants you a sly, black-fanged smile.
<ispeech>Anxiety-laced meat tastes exquisite. She was drenched with it. Fear... sweat... surprise...</ispeech>
"Yes, that would appear to be her."
[Slowly back away.] "Actually, no. I don't think that's the priestess I'm looking for."

"Start with the bird. He's been complaining ever since we arrived." 

Maia glares down at Ishiza, who cocks his head at her.

"A curse on Ngati for giving me such tender, delicious flesh, I say." 

Tekēhu chuckles anxiously and backs away a step.
Xoti chokes on a scream.
"You will find this meal most difficult to eat, dragon."

"Don't let this be fooling you, lass. Ain't nothing but fur and bones."

Serafen pats his belly even as he takes a nervous step back.
"Just realized how lucky we are to have never run across a sewer dragon."
"Now, now... that can't be healthy..."
A dry laugh crackles from the dragon's thick-scaled throat.

"And here with me thinking this dragon be out of place in the Deadfire."

He rolls his eyes.
"That's awfully cold-blooded for a creature made of fire."

"Must all dragons of the archipelago shackle themselves to someone else's cause?" 

Sighing, Tekēhu worries his brow.

"You know, Rauatai might be interested in a similar arrangement. I can put you in touch with the right people." 

Maia winks.
"That's a relief. Thought we were fighting a dragon. But this is just a big snake."
"One call to duty in centuries and you are too cowardly to answer it. Pathetic."
The dragon snorts smoke from her snout.

"And here with me thinking this dragon be out of place in the Deadfire."

He rolls his eyes.
"That's awfully cold-blooded for a creature made of fire."

"Must all dragons of the archipelago shackle themselves to someone else's cause?" 

Sighing, Tekēhu worries his brow.

"You know, Rauatai might be interested in a similar arrangement. I can put you in touch with the right people." 

Maia winks.
"One call to duty in centuries and you are too cowardly to answer it. Pathetic."
"That's a relief. Thought we were fighting a dragon. But this is just a big snake."
The dragon snorts smoke from her snout.
"How can I ignite the shrine to Magran in the Rathun's keep?"

<ispeech>Why, I believe the brenthís has the means you seek. A certain torc that she tried to wield against me.</ispeech>

Jadaferlas the Ancient laves the tip of an incisor with her tongue.
<ispeech>Sadly for her, its power could not hold a flame to mine. But as it was the brenthís' last sacrificial offering to me, you understand why I shall not allow it to be stolen.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Oh, little morsel. Did you think I would permit you to leave? No, you must stay and feast with me.</ispeech>
<ispeech>You would yet creep closer to me? You are either a cunning predator or an exquisite fool, indeed.</ispeech>

<ispeech>Are you still alive, trespasser? Have you come to tempt me with your tantalizing scent?</ispeech>

She chortles, and her wings sway through the scorching air like dead tree limbs - bone-dry and loudly cracking.
"Let me go now, and I'll bring you a feast fit for a queen. Later."
[Distract the dragon with some backflips and juggling.]
[Attack] "Feast on this."
<ispeech>Indeed, this is farewell for you, wretch. Your last farewell as it were.</ispeech>
<ispeech>When you die, know that it will be to provide me with the sweetest sustenance.</ispeech>
"Haven't you heard? Godlikes are terrible for your constitution."

<ispeech>I have not before savored the flesh of one so scarred by the gods.</ispeech>

The great beast snorts, and smoke puffs from her jagged snout.
<ispeech>Flee now, bitter god-spawn, lest I decide to sample your wretchedness for myself.</ispeech>
The dragon swivels her head to one side, watching you with ember-red eyes, intently interested.
<ispeech>How very amusing. What a treat - to watch one's dinner dancing so.</ispeech> Her low chuckle rumbles throughout the cavern.
But despite her threatening words, the great beast seems momentarily appeased, relaxing languidly onto her haunches and gazing away - giving you ample time to retreat.

<ispeech>Shall you? I do so like making deals.</ispeech>

The dragon cranes her neck out to scent you, puffing hot air across your skin.
<ispeech>You have whetted my appetite. So when you return, it must be with something exceptionally mouth watering.</ispeech>
"Attack me, beast, and it'll be the last thing you ever do."
The dragon sloshes into a crouch in the magma, reconsidering.
<ispeech>You, wretch? Shall you end my ceaselessly enduring eons - when giants could not?</ispeech>
"You're certainly conceited, I'll give you that."
<ispeech>Flattery will not save you now, little morsel. You should never have wandered into my den.</ispeech>

<ispeech>Your tongue is clever. It amuses me.</ispeech>

She snorts smoke from her nostrils.
<ispeech>And you, wretch, you are certainly soon to be dead.</ispeech>
"The Rathun failed to honor your magnificence, but I offer my service with humility, Oh Great One."

<ispeech>Do you now? And what need would one so ancient as I have for one so... tender as you?</ispeech>

She settles her large body slightly lower into the magma.
<ispeech>Or perhaps you are a tough one. Tougher then these Rathun.</ispeech>
<ispeech>You have whetted my appetite. Flee now, wretch, else I decide to sample your flesh for myself.</ispeech>
"It'd be an honor to meet such an end, but I'd rather live to tell of your magnificence."
[Cross your arms over your chest.] "Do I look like prey to you?"
<ispeech>What would you know of honor and how it relates to a being such as me?</ispeech>
Smoke curls from the Ancient's nostrils as she tips her face closer.
<ispeech>No. You are but a tiny morsel compared to my usual meal.</ispeech>
[Brandish your fists.] "Take a gander and find out."
A snarl sizzles from her throat and her wings crack about as she shifts, impatient.
[Shake your head.]
She returns her searing gaze to you.
Serafen winces at the suggestion, then gestures pointedly at the dragon.

White-hot pain lances through your head, drowning out the roar of the dragon. What replaces it is a low growl that sends vibrations through the chamber. 

A pair of amber eyes ignite from the shadows. Their attention forms a knot in your gut.
"H-hey, this wasn't part of our deal!"

"I say I make a better diversion than a sneak, but just this once. 

"Keep the beast talking." 

Tekēhu clears his throat and glances at the torc.
<ispeech>Only fools die fighting the gods. I have lived for eons, and I will live for eons longer.</ispeech>
"Why?! Why have you dishonored our agreement, Ancient One?! The brenthís came to call you into battle!"
"Foul traitor! You wretched godsforsaken beast!" The warrior's hair flickers wildly beneath her helm, growing violent with her fury.

<ispeech>That arrogant priestess thought to ride ME - THE MAGMA THAT FIRES THE MOUNTAIN! She sought to command me! 

So I consumed her.</ispeech>
<ispeech>The Rathun forged their deal when I was but a hatchling. Now no one controls me. And I would never fight a god for fools!</ispeech>
"Oh Mighty Ancient One, as your respectful and humble worshiper, surely we might come to an honorable agreement?"
"You will burn for your treachery, creature!"
<ispeech>I fear neither flame nor fools!</ispeech> She rustles her wings in ominous warning.

"Do not speak your lies before our sacred fires, vermin. The Ancient would never attack us!"

The warrior hefts her weapon to the ready, furious.
<ispeech>I did, fool. And I would again.</ispeech>
"Blessed and terrible Ancient one! The bathor sends me in search of -"
"Why?! Why have you dishonored our agreement, Ancient One?! The brenthís came to call you into battle!"

<ispeech>That arrogant priestess thought to ride ME - THE MAGMA THAT FIRES THE MOUNTAIN! She sought to command me! 

So I consumed her.</ispeech>
<ispeech>The Rathun forged their deal when I was but a hatchling. Now no one controls me. And I would never fight a god for fools!</ispeech>
"Foul traitor! You wretched godsforsaken beast!" The warrior's hair flickers wildly beneath her helm, growing violent with her fury.
"You are a creature most amusing. Perhaps I shall yet allow you to live."
The giant trembles with outrage, the fiery scrawls in her skin flaring briefly.

"You swore to glut the survivors on the remains of the dead, but the souls of the Dyrwood groan with hunger." 

The eyes narrow. Then their focus shifts toward the creature.

"The souls of the Dyrwood glow with life. The dead have served the needs of the living." 

The eyes bob as their owner nods with approval.
"When my champion closes his jaws around you, know that it is my teeth which pierce your hide." Galawain nods toward the magma dragon and eases back into the shadows.

"Take this reprieve from the hunt, but do not let your teeth blunt on complacency." 

When the eyes close, it is as if they were never there.

A rush of adrenaline courses from your head to your toes, filling you with warmth and vigor. Nothing has changed, but now you see the dragon as merely one in a long line of prey extending both behind and ahead of you. 

A pair of amber eyes regard you from the shadows of the chamber.
<ispeech>Igniting Magran's shrine lowers it into the Maw so that a brenthís may worship before the adra pillar, see.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Igniting Magran's shrine lowers it into the Maw so that a brenthís may worship before the adra pillar, see.</ispeech>
